intro: Nematanthus albus, commonly known as the white-flowered ice plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many succulent species. The plant is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of tiny, white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a decorative plant in arid climates.
